summaries.body: Rosie O'Donnell said her daughter Chelsea, 17, was found and is with the police, hours after pleading for the public's help in locating her. She went missing on Aug. 11.

display_asset.caption: Members of the University of Alabama’s Alpha Phi sorority ran out of Bryant-Denny Stadium during Bid Day on Aug. 16, 2014.

summaries.body: A video by a sorority at the University of Alabama was pulled after criticism of its portrayal of women -- shown dancing and frolicking in swimsuits -- and lack of diversity.

display_asset.caption: An Atlas model in 2013.

summaries.body: Scientists working to develop the human-like walking and balance skills of Atlas, a humanoid robot, took it on a stroll through the woods.

display_asset.caption: “Piccolo Uovo,” or “Little Egg,” the tale of an unhatched egg that sees happiness in various family configurations, is one of the banned books.
display_asset.credit: Mattia Balsamini for The New York Times

summaries.body: The new conservative mayor of Venice bans some books from the city’s preschools, setting off a debate about Italy and gay rights. (Above, “Piccolo Uovo,” or “Little Egg.”)
The Islamic State has called for the people of Turkey to overthrow “Satan,” a reference to President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, in response to U.S.-Turkey military cooperation.
The police in Russia, where imports of Western cheese have been banned in response to sanctions, have stopped an international ring producing contraband cheese.
The British inflation rate unexpectedly rose in July, though it is still well below the Bank of England’s 2 percent target, and a core measure of price growth hit a five-month high.
French officials are scaling down the hunt for wreckage from a missing Malaysia Airlines flight after 10 days of searching off Réunion failed to yield any discoveries.

display_asset.caption: Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin attended the Iowa State Fair in Des Moines, Iowa, Monday.
display_asset.credit: Eric Thayer for The New York Times

summaries.body: Scott Walker’s presidential campaign reached out to a strategist, a sign Mr. Walker is considering staff changes as his bid is being eclipsed by Donald J. Trump.

display_asset.caption: C. C. Sabathia on Monday. His scheduled start was pushed back a day, although Joe Girardi said the  decision had nothing to do with Sabathia’s confrontation in Toronto over the weekend.

summaries.body: C. C. Sabathia acknowledged having used poor judgment in confronting a heckler outside a Toronto nightclub after video of the incident was released on the website TMZ.

display_asset.caption: Leonard B. Robinson visited a hospital in Charleston, W.Va., on Aug. 15, 2014.
display_asset.credit: Kenny Kemp/The Charleston Gazette, via Associated Press

summaries.body: Leonard B. Robinson, a Maryland man whose charity work masquerading as Batman for thousands of sick children gained national attention, was hit by a car and killed.
A Palestinian man was fatally shot after he approached an Israeli checkpoint feigning illness and then tried to stab border officers, an Israeli police spokeswoman said.

display_asset.caption: Bryan Mitchell on Tuesday after he was struck in the face by a line drive off the bat of Eduardo Nunez.
display_asset.credit: Adam Hunger/USA Today Sports, via Reuters

summaries.body: A Yankees game turned grisly after pitcher Bryan Mitchell took a line drive from the Minnesota Twins’ Eduardo Nunez off the right side of his skull.

display_asset.caption: At Greetings, a shop in Oakland, Calif., Maya Grady found a sign of the minimal damage caused by Monday’s earthquake, a stuffed animal that fell.

summaries.body: After a small earthquake, Californians had fun posting their reactions on a Geological Survey website. "Disneyland had better rides,” one of them said.
At least five police officers were poisoned and then shot to death in southern Afghanistan, officials said.

display_asset.caption: A Moscow market. Every important step in a Malaysia Airlines inquiry has been met with enhanced inspections of Dutch flower exports by Russia.
display_asset.credit: Sergey Ponomarev for The New York Times

summaries.body: A Russian crackdown on Dutch flower imports is being seen by some as a response to an investigation into the shooting down of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 over Ukraine.
Emile Hirsch, the actor, began serving 15 days in a Utah jail after pleading guilty to assault for putting a female studio executive in a chokehold at a nightclub.
Lawyers for Dzhokhar Tsarnaev appealed his conviction and death sentence in the Boston Marathon bombing, arguing that publicity made it impossible for him to get a fair trial.

display_asset.caption: Stevie Wonder performed Monday on the Armory Mall outside R.F.K. Stadium in Washington.

summaries.body: After making stops in Washington and Philadelphia earlier Monday, Stevie Wonder will perform a final free pop-up concert in Central Park at 7:30 p.m. Eastern.

display_asset.caption: David Denson, center, plays for the Helena Brewers, the Pioneer League affiliate of the Milwaukee Brewers. Spelled out on his jersey is the Salish translation of “pioneer.”

summaries.body: David Denson, center, a minor leaguer for the Milwaukee Brewers, is the first player actively affiliated with Major League Baseball to publicly reveal that he is gay.
At least 16 people were killed in central Bangkok after a blast occurred in front of the Erawan shrine, an important tourist attraction in the city's main shopping district.
A report approved on Monday by the Iraqi Parliament blames Nuri Kamal al-Maliki, the former prime minister, and other senior officials for the fall of Mosul in 2014.

display_asset.caption: Parma players taking a break during training. In Serie D, rules prohibit teams from paying much more than a player’s expenses — the maximum salary after taxes is a little more than $22,000 a year.
display_asset.credit: Colagero Russo for The New York Times

summaries.body: Hamstrung by financial difficulties, Parma F.C. was headed for dissolution. Now it is reborn, albeit in a lesser league with an altered name and a revised concept of ownership.
Egypt has opened its border with the Gaza Strip for the first time in two months, with about 20,000 applying to exit. The crossing has been open for only 15 days this year.
President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi of Egypt has approved stringent counterterrorism laws, but human rights groups say the legislation will be used to crush dissent.
A book with pages that contain nanoparticles of silver or copper, which kill bacteria in contaminated water, has shown to be an effective way to filter water in field trials.

display_asset.caption: An article in China Newsweek said Sanlitun had “Beijing’s longest night,” where foreigners and Chinese party until morning.

summaries.body: The killing of a young Chinese woman and the wounding of her French husband by a man with a sword on Thursday brings the Beijing district of Sanlitun under scrutiny.
The White House is to announce on Monday a plan that pairs public health and law enforcement in an effort to shift the focus from punishment to treatment of heroin addicts.
In Bangladesh, 13 men face charges of beating a 13-year-old boy to death. The case stunned the nation after a video of the boy being tortured was posted online.
Premier Li Keqiang of China visited people who were injured and displaced after a series of explosions at a chemical warehouse in Tianjin last week.

display_asset.caption: Manchester City’s Vincent Kompany, left, and David Silva after Kompany scored.

summaries.body: Manchester City tops the Premier League standings after a 3-0 win over Chelsea on Sunday, ahead of Leicester and Manchester United on goal difference.

display_asset.caption: In the days after news spread about the killing of Cecil, the well-known lion in Zimbabwe, news organizations large and small peppered sites like Facebook with hundreds of links and posts about his death.

summaries.body: As more readers move toward online social networks, and as publishers seek scale to bring in revenue, many have deplored a race toward repetitive journalism.
A controversial bill introduced to the Australian Parliament would allow couples to marry, regardless of "sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or intersex status."
Myanmar's ruling party is to meet on Monday, where members are to discuss introducing a bill to impeach Shwe Mann, the ousted party leader and speaker of Parliament.

display_asset.caption: Jordan Spieth hit a drive on the fifth hole of the P.G.A. Championship at Whistling Straits in Haven, Wis.

summaries.body: Jordan Spieth, above, fired a five-under-par 67 on Friday to climb up the leaderboard at the P.G.A. Championship. A thunderstorm suspended play with the round incomplete.

display_asset.caption: Detectives Wayne Carter, center, and Timothy Callinan talked with Andrea Mesa and her son Anthony last week, following up on a tip in a missing child case.
display_asset.credit: Suzanne Kreiter/The Boston Globe, via Associated Press

summaries.body: For nearly eight weeks, investigators in Massachusetts have been struggling to solve a mystery: the identity of a girl whose remains were found on a Boston Harbor shoreline.
The British royal family appealed to media groups to prevent the publication of unauthorized photographs of Prince George. Above, a pool photo from his sister's christening.

display_asset.credit: South Korean Defense Ministry, via Getty Images

summaries.body: North Korea denied planting land mines that maimed two South Korean soldiers in their half of the Demilitarized Zone last week. Above, a patrol near the scene.
Ballots have been sent out to choose the next leader of the Labour Party, which is trying to regain its footing. A breakdown of where the candidates stand on key issues.
The higher the rate of gun ownership in a state, the higher the likelihood of a law enforcement officer being killed, a new study has found.

display_asset.caption: Scientists at Stanford have engineered yeast that enabled the conversion of sugar into thebaine and hydrocodone, a narcotic.

summaries.body: In a widely expected advance that has opened a debate about “home-brewed heroin,” scientists at Stanford have created strains of yeast that can produce narcotic drugs.
A former United Nations intern who was found sleeping outside in a tent has called for unpaid interns to unite, and wants the world body to live up to its own ideals.

display_asset.caption: Students at a candlelight vigil at Virginia Tech in April 2012 on the fifth anniversary of the killing of 32 students and faculty member.

summaries.body: Eight years after the Virginia Tech massacre, survivors and families announced a program intended to make campuses safer, hoping it will serve as a legacy to the 32 victims.

display_asset.caption: The Rowan County Courthouse in Rowan County, Kentucky, where two same-sex couples were refused marriage licenses on Thursday.
display_asset.credit: Jessica Ebelhar for The New York Times

summaries.body: A clerk in Rowan County, Ky., defied a federal court order to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples. Two couples left the courthouse empty-handed on Thursday.

display_asset.caption: The blast in Sadr City on Thursday, which was almost immediately claimed by the Islamic State, happened just after dawn, when the market was already crowded with shoppers.

summaries.body: The Islamic State claimed responsibility for a truck bomb in the largely Shiite Baghdad neighborhood of Sadr City that killed nearly 60 people and wounded more than 100 others.
Sweden stopped investigating Julian Assange of WikiLeaks in two sexual assault cases after the statute of limitations expired. It will continue to investigate a rape accusation.
Emirates, an airline based in Dubai, will start flying to Panama City next year, and the journey of 17 hours and 35 minutes will be the longest nonstop route in the world.
Relatives of British service members who were killed in the Iraq War have said they will take legal action if a report on the conflict is not published within two weeks.
A 22-year-old from New Zealand quit his unpaid internship with the United Nations after it was revealed he was living in a tent because he could not afford housing in Geneva.
Researchers published findings on an unusual octopus that engages in "beak to beak" mating.
The lawyer Gloria Allred introduced three women with new accusations against Bill Cosby and challenged a lawyer for Mr. Cosby to debate a raft of sexual allegations.

display_asset.caption: This courtroom sketch of Tom Brady, far right, sparked a rash of online criticism Wednesday.

summaries.body: Jane Rosenberg, a New York artist, apologized to Tom Brady for "not making him as good-looking as he is" in a courtroom sketch that was widely mocked online.

display_asset.caption: The last of the balls head toward the Los Angeles reservoir.

summaries.body: Officials in California released 20,000 small black orbs, known as "shade balls," into a reservoir in Los Angeles to combat a nagging drought.

display_asset.caption: Alibaba's founder, Jack Ma, at a conference in Nanjing, China, this week.

summaries.body: Alibaba reported lower than expected profits and said that it would buy back $4 billion in shares in an effort to shore up its stock price, down 35 percent from its high.

display_asset.caption: Kim Kardashian West holds a bottle of the morning sickness drug Diclegis in a post from her Instagram account.

summaries.body: The F.D.A. sent a warning to a drug company, saying Kim Kardashian West's Instagram post promoting its morning sickness drug failed to give information about its risks.
Heavy shelling by rebels and Syrian government airstrikes killed at least 36 in Damascus and wounded scores more just hours before a visit by Iran's foreign minister.
A panel in Afghanistan called for the retrial of men accused of the brutal killing of a female scholar. A court had secretly commuted death sentences of four of the men.

posts.footer: A New York Times reporter, via Twitter

summaries.body: Islamic State franchise in Egypt posts pictures showing severed head of Croatian hostage, a week after making demands for prisoner exchange
A Polish court that was to rule on a request to extradite Roman Polanski to the United States said it had not received requested legal help from the Americans.
British airport shops are being urged to pass on tax savings obtained when customers show boarding passes for destinations outside the European Union.

posts.footer: A Times reporter in Ferguson, Mo., via Twitter

summaries.body: All was quiet this evening in Ferguson. Police say no arrests were made tonight. http://t.co/SyXOOpTDja

display_asset.caption: Billy Sherrill in the studio in the mid-1970s with Tammy Wynette, whose career Mr. Sherrill helped kick-start.
display_asset.credit: The Nashville Songwriters Hall of Fame

summaries.body: The Nashville producer Billy Sherrill, an architect of the "countrypolitan" sound that added lush strings and overdubs to country music during the 1960s and '70s, died at 78.
The head of a bipartisan advocacy group opposed to the nuclear agreement with Iran resigned on Monday after concluding that he supports the deal.
The St. Louis County police released a video that they say shows the teenager who was shot by their officers pulling a gun out of his waistband and pointing it.

display_asset.caption: A brothel in Barcelona, Spain, in 2012.  Amnesty International delegates voted on Tuesday to support a policy that calls for decriminalization of the sex trade.
display_asset.credit: Marta Ramoneda for The New York Times

summaries.body: Amnesty International voted to support a policy that calls for decriminalization of the sex trade, including prostitution, payment for sex and brothel ownership.
Tonight is the opening night of the Perseid meteor shower's peak. Here's how to best watch the show.

display_asset.caption: Tracy Morgan and his fiancèe, Megan Wollover, during an appearance on "NBC Nightly News" in June.

summaries.body: Federal regulators cited a Walmart truck driver’s fatigue as the chief cause of a crash last year that killed the comedian James McNair and critically injured Tracy Morgan.

display_asset.caption: The N.F.L. draft was moved out of New York in 2015 for the first time since the 1960s partly because the league had been trying to popularize the event.
display_asset.credit: Joshua Lott for The New York Times

summaries.body: The N.F.L. said it would hold its annual college draft in Chicago for a second consecutive year. It was moved out of New York in 2015 for the first time since the 1960s.
LIVE NOW: #DustStorm Warning in #Phoenix, #Arizona...zero visibility. #PullAsideStayAlive #AZwx #dust

posts.footer: A Times reporter in Washington on Mr. Trump's suggestion for handling the Islamic State, via Twitter

summaries.body: "Take the oil, knock the hell out of 'em" - Donald J.Trump, discussing foreign policy, on Fox News.

display_asset.credit: Australian Institute of Marine Science, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

summaries.body: Australia announced a greenhouse gas reduction goal one its neighbors immediately criticized as too weak. “If the rest of the world followed Australia’s lead, the Great Barrier Reef (above) would disappear,” said the Marshall Islands’ foreign minister. “So would my country.”

display_asset.caption: Nebia has tested prototypes of its shower head on the campuses of Apple, Google and Stanford University.

summaries.body: Nebia, a start-up that has developed a water-conserving shower head, already has funding from top Silicon Valley figures, including the Apple chief executive Timothy D. Cook.
Army bomb disposal teams were preparing to defuse and detonate a 500 pound World War II bomb unearthed by developers building luxury apartments in East London.
The World Food Program head said funding prospects are "bleak" and that Syrian refugees are likely to face more cuts in food aid. Above, refugees in Jordan.

posts.footer: The Marshall Islands' foreign minister on Australia's new goal of bringing carbon emissions at least 26% below 2005 levels by 2030, which environmentalists called inadequate, via Twitter

summaries.body: If the rest of world followed Australia's lead, the Great Barrier Reef would disappear. So would my country. http://t.co/IfXLiP64vn #climate
NBC, which has used English soccer to define its NBCSN cable network, retained Premier League rights through the 2021-22 season in a deal worth about $1 billion.
An Indonesian court dismissed a $125 million sexual abuse lawsuit filed against a prestigious international school by the parents of a former kindergarten student.

display_asset.caption: The green veined white butterfly is among six species of butterfly that could face extinction in Britain by 2050 as a result of climate change.

summaries.body: Six species of butterflies in Britain will face local extinctions by 2050 because of climate change, particularly in dry areas such as Southeast England, a report said.

display_asset.caption: "Who wants lettuce?" Preparing for the first taste test of produce harvested in space.

summaries.body: The local food movement has reached outer space. International Space Station astronauts harvested a batch of “Outredgeous” red romaine lettuce grown in space.

display_asset.caption: Benedict Cumberbatch performed in the director Lyndsey Turner's production of “Hamlet” at the Barbican in London last week.

summaries.body: Benedict Cumberbatch asked audience members to stop using cellphone cameras, saying it was mortifying during a production of "Hamlet" to see the lights from the stage.

display_asset.caption: Announcing his share purchase, Jack Dorsey tweeted that he was “investing in Twitter’s future.”

summaries.body: Jack Dorsey, Twitter's co-founder and interim chief executive, bought more of its stock, as top executives try to show they still believe in the company.

display_asset.credit: Jerry Mcbride/The Durango Herald, via A.P.

summaries.body: A toxic spill from a mine into a Colorado river is larger than previously stated, and federal authorities are unsure if the polluted water poses a health threat.

display_asset.caption: “Hung up for a day and a night and given electric shocks. One or two hours each time, causing me to lose consciousness.”

summaries.body: A series of drawings depicting the ordeal of a man wrongly convicted of murder in China have captured public attention because of their candid depiction of police abuse.
A car bomb exploded near the entrance to Kabul airport, killing at least four people and wounding 17, days after a series of other fatal suicide attacks in the Afghan capital.

display_asset.caption: Athletes passed the Tatarstan presidential palace during the men’s 25-kilometer open-water event on Aug. 1.

summaries.body: Since its millennium celebration in 2005, Kazan has reinvented itself as a Russian athletics capital, becoming a top host of world and European tournaments.
A stampede at a temple during a Hindu religious festival in the eastern Indian state of Jharkhand left at least 11 people dead and 20 injured, officials said.
Typhoon Soudelor caused flash foods and landslides on China's east coast, leaving 14 people dead and four missing. Hundreds of thousands of people were evacuated.
The infant mortality rate in Gaza rose for first time in more than half a century, according to a new study by the United Nations Relief and Works Agency.

display_asset.caption: Katie Ledecky after winning the 200-meter freestyle final last week in Russia. In two world championships, Ledecky, 18, is nine for nine in finals.

summaries.body: If swimming’s Olympic program were to expand, the women’s 1,500-meter freestyle competition is not likely to be included. Katie Ledecky, above, broke her 1,500-freestyle record last week.
The body of Miguel Angel Jimenez Blanco, an activist in Mexico who led search parties for 43 students who disappeared last year, was found near his home in Guerrero.
Efforts by Minería Texas Colombia, an American company, to raise the standards of Colombia's dangerous emerald mining trade have been met with violence.
The San Francisco 49ers cut Aldon Smith after his arrest Thursday on hit-and-run, drunken driving and vandalism charges.
Zachary Hammond, an unarmed white 19-year-old, was shot in July by an officer in South Carolina, but the episode escaped much of the debate over police behavior.
Italy rescued 1,200 migrants in operations in the Mediterranean, including this baby. The police also arrested human traffickers after hundreds of migrants died at sea.
Attackers with machetes killed a blogger in Bangladesh, the fourth death of an online critic of religious extremism in the Muslim-majority country in six months.

posts.footer: The Guardian | The New Zealand Herald

summaries.body: Australia and England have begun the second day of their much-watched cricket match, after what some media called "the worst day" in the history of Australian cricket.
Swiss authorities have identified the remains of two Japanese climbers who went missing 45 years ago. Their bones were found on a glacier at the Matterhorn.
A French woman who was abducted in Yemen in February has been freed. Isabelle Prime, 30, had been working on a World Bank-financed project when she was kidnapped.
Anesthetic gas may have been used against the Formula 1 driver Jenson Button and his wife during a burglary in France. Valuables reportedly worth $467,000 were taken.

posts.footer: Secretary of State John Kerry, speaking in Hanoi, Vietnam, to commemorate 20 years of diplomatic ties between Vietnam and the United States, via The Associated Press

summaries.body: The war that took place here half a century ago divided each of our countries and stemmed from the most profound failure of diplomatic insight and political vision.
